results.content: Really great course that lays out the basic framework for working with the Duplicator Plug-In for moving a WordPress site.  The author could have quickly touched on a few issues/options for the Duplicator plug-in like manual zip extraction and pointing out the error log for troubleshooting.  There's a lot to cover that could go wrong, which could easily go outside the scope of this course, but a quick pointing out of a few of these tools would have been very helpful to be aware of.

results.content: My favorite Udemy instructor! Robobunnyattack addresses the basic knowledge that I need in a clear and concise manner. This particular course also has a printable guideline for a wordpress migration checklist, which is very helpful for newbies to wordpress.

results.content: The course tells you everything you need to know to move your Wordpress site to another domain or to another web host. The slides and live demonstrations were clear and Kathleen teaches in a light and encouraging tone. She makes everything easy to understand. The support via discussion was very helpful.

results.content: OUT OF DATE MATERIAL: NOT HELPFUL @ ALL. Don't waste your time on this course. I have an entry level understanding of wordpress and although she provides several good recommendations her video is out of date. She also skipped several steps meaning that you would have to try to figure out the in between before she got to that step. 2nd she is not answering questions. So do yourself a favor and find another course. This one is not worth it.

results.content: As rudimentary as reading, writing and math...this skill should be one of the basics needed for anyone looking to use WP.  This course is easy to follow and perfect for newbies just starting out or the WP professional.  For the newbies, don't be intimidated by the tools and methods presented.  It works perfectly and will save you time and money should you ever need to copy/move your WP site.  Well worth the investment!

results.content: looking forward to migrating my instant wordpress testing sites to my host.  I have done it once before really similar but this does it a little differently.  I will be using this method next.  Well done and thanks.
results.content_html: looking forward to migrating my instant wordpress testing sites to my host. I have done it once before really similar but this does it a little differently. I will be using this method next. Well done and thanks.

results.content: This course is exactly what I needed. I am a self-taught WordPress web designer. I have been using other tools that seem to have quirks & errors and have, in the past, had to resort to moving sites manually; Which is time consuming. I had heard good things about the Duplicator Plugin for WordPress, and this course offers a thorough, step-by-step walk through the process. With lots of optional info for folks who are newbies - explanations of terms and tools and resources to help people understand - but on separate pages, so if you don't need them, you can skip them. The downloadable check list is great too! The only minor flaw (especially for newbies) is not mentioning that the the FTP tool she uses Cyberduck is a program for Mac/Apple cmputers (I could not find a windows 10 version) - she could note that the most popular Windows FTP program is Filezilla, although there are others. Great course
results.content_html: This course is exactly what I needed. I am a self-taught WordPress web designer.
